intro: Lacinaria punctata f. corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered lacinaria, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive inflorescence. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical structure makes it an interesting subject for horticultural and ecological studies.
